metadata.Title: CVE-2020-1720 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
A flaw was found in PostgreSQL's "ALTER ... DEPENDS ON EXTENSION", wheresub-commands did not perform authorization checks. An authenticatedattacker could use this flaw in certain configurations to perform dropobjects such as function, triggers, et al., leading to database corruption.This issue affects PostgreSQL versions before 12.2, before 11.7, before10.12 and before 9.6.17.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-1720` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libecpg-compat3 - 10.12-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
libecpg6 - 10.12-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
libpgtypes3 - 10.12-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
libpq5 - 10.12-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
postgresql-10 - 10.12-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
postgresql-client-10 - 10.12-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
postgresql-plperl-10 - 10.12-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
postgresql-plpython-10 - 10.12-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
postgresql-plpython3-10 - 10.12-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
postgresql-pltcl-10 - 10.12-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: postgresql-10 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '10.12-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
